item.title: 注释 (2024/8/14 11:37:48)
item.description:
(Zhang 等, 2020, p. 3) Fig. 1. Experimental apparatus.

(Zhang 等, 2020, p. 4) Fig. 2. Flame propagation behaviors of 30 μm aluminum dust cloud under (a) air, (b) 90 % by volume fraction for nitrogen, (c) 90 % by volume fraction for carbon dioxide, and (d) 5% by volume fraction for C3HF7 atmosphere with aluminum dust concentration of 1000 g/m3.

(Zhang 等, 2020, p. 5) Fig. 3. Flame propagation velocities of 30 μm aluminum dust cloud under different inhibition volume fractions of (a) nitrogen, (b) carbon dioxide, and (c) C3HF7 atmosphere with aluminum dust concentration of 1000 g/m3.

(Zhang 等, 2020, p. 6) Fig. 4. Pressure histories of 30 μm aluminum dust cloud under different inhibition volume fractions of (a) nitrogen, (b) carbon dioxide, (c) C3HF7 with aluminum dust concentration of 1000 g/m3, and (d) inhibition curves of inhibitors for 30 μm aluminum dust.

(Zhang 等, 2020, p. 7) Fig. 5. XRD patterns of explosion product residue of 30 μm aluminum dust cloud using (a) C3HF7, (b) 90 % nitrogen and (c) 90 % carbon dioxide as gas inhibitors. Dust concentration: 1000 g/m3.

(Zhang 等, 2020, p. 8) Fig. 6. The XPS analysis of explosion residues using nitrogen and carbon dioxide as gas inhibitor. Dust concentration: 1000 g/m3, inhibition volume fraction:90 %.

(Zhang 等, 2020, p. 9) Fig. 7. (a)-(b)Sensitivity analysis of flame temperature of gaseous aluminum explosion, maximum rate of production (MROP) for (c)-(d) AlO and (e)-(f) O radicals using nitrogen and carbon dioxide as gas inhibitors under different inhibition volume fractions.

(Zhang 等, 2020, p. 10) Fig. 8. Inhibition mechanism of micron-sized aluminum dust explosion by inert gas and the critical path of gas phase aluminum particle combustion.
